SCID-5-PD Annotations: Avoids occupational activities that involve significant interpersonal contact because of fears of criticism, disapproval, or rejection.
Is unwilling to get involved with people unless certain of being liked.
Shows restraint within intimate relationships because of the fear of being shamed or ridiculed.
Is preoccupied with being criticized or rejected in social situations.
Is inhibited in new interpersonal situations because of feelings of inadequacy.
Views self as socially inept, personally unappealing, or inferior to others.
Is unusually reluctant to take personal risks or to engage in any new activities because they may prove embarrassing.
evidence:
I am in a very similar situation, but I told her a few weeks ago and nothing changed. It was really bad timing because she is currently in a break up. When I told her I was in a weird place mentally. I spent two days in a row with her and I was feeling ”to happy“. I was expecting a really bad backlash just around the corner and I was getting paranoid. I essentially created the backlash by telling her and having a complete mental breakdown because she was a bit dismissive and overwhelmed. A friend said that I have good chances with her and it really messes with me. I never had a girlfriend and the uncertainty kills me. I write with her everyday and see her like 5 times a week, which seems very promising. 

But I don‘t think it could even be remotely possible that she likes me as much as I like her. I know her since I was 10 years old and fell in love with her the moment I saw her. Now I’m 21 btw. We didn‘t see each other for years but I spent an evening with her and some friends a few years ago and my brain was f••ked immediately. Of course I didn‘t even talk to her at all for months because I am an anxious piece of shit. Eventually she got together with a friend of mine and at that moment I started smoking weed and it was a pretty effective distraction to be honest. But I never quite managed to forget her.

I am really afraid of her, because she could basically destroy me. I still conquer that fear on a daily basis, just because it‘s worth it to me. I basically use her as motivation to learn how to deal with fear, which is a good thing in the long run I guess.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability, Separation insecurity, Identity problems, Fragility, Low invulnerability

I definitely do. It depends on the situation and on the person, if I let it out on them or not. Most of the time I let it out elsewhere, because most of the people I get angry at are the ones I care about. Sometimes I use anger to motivate me to do something. It gives me energy. But I never lose control over it. Maybe I should sometimes.
Hostility, Emotional lability

I relate. But the truth is that anyone has some level of anxiety. I know we are probably some of the worst cases but if you don‘t expose yourself to the perceived ”danger“ it will get worse. I believe most people wouldn‘t look down on you if they found out about your anxiety. And if someone does then it‘s because he or she is a bad person in my opinion and you shouldn‘t care about what that person thinks about you.

I think the most important think is that you always remind yourself that this fear is irrational. That is a fact. Once you accept that you can try to stop basing your decisions and actions on that fear and overcome it step by step. It is a lot easier said than done, but I have been able to get better that way. But I still get thrown back at times. A few weeks ago I was so anxious I had to leave the university and drive home, because my professor directly looked at me and I felt like I was about to have a complete mental breakdown. I wish you the best and hope you get better.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability

I recently had that realization too. But I think it also is the other way around, which is why it is so hard to get out of the bottomless pit once you are in. I just discovered that I actually really enjoy change in my life, because the last year almost every week was exactly the same. I feel like I need to keep moving to feel okay.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability, Problematic impulsivity

I know. I am just saying the longer you isolate yourself the harder it gets. This doesn‘t mean I am not willing to try. I am using it as motivation to try harder right here and right now, because it will only get worse if I don‘t.
Withdrawal

I have been diagnosed too and I can relate to basically everything you said. And I don‘t think I have been misdiagnosed. Thinking you are better than someone is a protective mechanism. It keeps you from actually getting close or caring about anyone. In the past I secretly believed I was better than everyone. Now at times I believe I am the worst. But I think you have to try to see that everyone is worth the same. There are just people you can get along with and people you can‘t get along with. But that doesn‘t make them better or worse either.
Identity problems, Low empathy, Grandiosity

Thanks for sharing this. Without knowing I was already doing this. I always think about distant memories and things my parents tell me happened and try to figure out how they affected my view on myself and the world around me. But it definitely wasn’t over night for me. The problem I am currently facing is that my father keeps generating new memories that I need to keep working against.
Perseveration, Identity problems, Negative relationships

I have been in that situation multiple times. But at some point I had to do stuff last minute and was able to be a half time hermit again. You shouldn‘t give up just because it‘s hard and I know it‘s hard. And you shouldn‘t be harsh on yourself. You are allowed to isolate yourself for a bit, but you have to start doing something sooner or later and keep going no matter how much you fail.
Withdrawal, Low ruminative deliberation

I have been into music production for years now. But due to toxic perfectionism I took a year to finish my first song and I don‘t even like it now. At the moment I am kind of at the other end of the spectrum where I am just too lazy to do anything with lots of effort. But at least I get shit done I guess. At the moment I don‘t create much, because I just don‘t feel a lot and music without feeling is just noise to me.

 I only share my stuff with friends in my car from time to time. I have been thinking about uploading some kind of beattape to soundcloud. But I would be too embarrassed to share it on social media because I am basically nonexistent everywhere on the internet and I think it would come off weird. Even though I think I am pretty good at producing.
Low rigid perfectionism, Anhedonia, Intimacy avoidance, Withdrawal, Low attention seeking

Sometimes I feel exactly as you describe it. I tell people about stuff that destroyed me when it happened and laugh about it. I think I appear really carefree. But it‘s just about half of the time.

The other half I am just quiet and shy. It isn‘t always related to me feeling bad it‘s just my uncontrollable depression and anxiety. Some people ask me if something is wrong sometimes and I can‘t even reply and don‘t even want to most of the time.

I recently started seeing a psychologist, quit smoking weed and started taking antidepressants. I feel weird, because I feel like being a stoner was my identity.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability, Depressivity, Identity problems

For me weed helped a lot with anxiety and I always felt more normal when I smoked. I could just say anything that comes to mind and didn‘t care a lot. If it was weird then f___ it I‘m high that‘s my excuse. But I definitely get what you are saying about being cold. For me the thing is I am pretty cold and numb due to my depression making me unable to feel a lot. And since weed made me less depressed it made me more warm I guess. But some other people definitely are the way you described.
Anxiousness, Depressivity, Anhedonia, Low restricted affectivity

I agree 100%. Or at least the logical and rational thinking part of me does. But experiences I had, make me feel like it‘s almost impossible to be loved by anyone. Also people who don‘t know me well only get to see me as arrogant most of the time and depressed the rest of the time. I just wish someone could look past the facade I put up, because I can‘t let go of it.

I deserve to be liked, to have friends, to be empathized with. But that doesn‘t make it happen.
Anhedonia, Emotional lability, Fragility, Low restricted affectivity

I was in a similar position and didn‘t do anything so I don‘t know. I guess this is not the right place to ask because we are mostly socially inept here. You would need something you could do with her outside of school. Just any reason to hang out with you.

I used to smoke weed almost every day with a girl, but I don‘t have any contact with her whatsoever. Smoking weed was basically the only thing I could do with people. Now I don‘t smoke anymore and I stay at home all day. Drugs were really bad for me am I right?
Social ineptitude, Withdrawal, Anhedonia

Sorry if it came across that way, but I‘d never recommend drugs to anyone. If you can‘t even talk to her then how could you even know if you would even want to spend time with her? 

I have been exactly the same. I was obsessed with a girl for years and didn‘t even talk to her. I dreamed that she told me she loved me and when I woke up I turned completely cold. I didn‘t cry once for 5 years even though I hated every day of my life. And everything because of a girl I didn‘t even know a lot about.

My advice would just be to try to get to know her somehow at least. I know it is really scary, but you have to confront your imagination of who she is with the real person. Then there are two basic outcomes: You like her or you don‘t. The good thing is that the human brain is wired so that if a person is nice you like that person and if they are not you don‘t like them. The most difficult thing would be to tell if she is just being polite or actually likes you.

I would just hope that you don‘t go down the same road as I did. I imagined that she was the only one for me and I wasn‘t able to fulfill my only purpose. You just need to know she is made of flesh and bone like every other person.
Identity problems, Anhedonia, Intimacy avoidance, Withdrawal, Fragility

I chose option 2 around when I was 13. At 20 I chose option 1 and I hate it almost as much as option 2. But I think option 2 is only bearable with drugs. Option 1 at least makes you believe someone cares about you from time to time.
Low invulnerability

I was diagnosed with avpd and this is definitely a big problem for me. I would say it‘s the core problem. Once you get past the surface level anxiety there are 20 more levels beneath and it takes ages to become truly comfortable with someone. And once I get really close to someone I can‘t even show much affection, because I am too afraid to do that. It would take someone who is really patient with me and understands me somehow even though that seems impossible without having the disorder yourself or being a professional who treats it.
Separation insecurity, Intimacy avoidance, Low attention seeking

I am in the same position. She got back together with her ex after spending almost every day with me and didn‘t even think it could bother me at all. I told her about my feelings and now we keep “safe distance“.

She told me she thought we were just the best friends ever. And she thought telling me about her problems and things that happened in the past would make me not love her anymore. But I loved every part of her.

Now I am just lonely as fuck, hating myself for not being good enough for her and my ”friends“ don‘t seem to care either. I spend all my time at home or at my university. I desperately try to make friends at the uni, but I don’t really feel connected to everyone.

I am just waiting for something to happen, but of course nothing changes. I am sorry, but I have no positivity whatsoever and can‘t tell you what to do. The only thing I can tell you is that you are not the only one.
Anhedonia, Depressivity, Withdrawal, Low invulnerability

I was getting into therapy because of depression. I didn‘t even know that my behavior was that bad when I just stayed home all day. For years I actively supressed any emotions that came up and tried to be as rational as possible at all times (it doesn‘t work). I eventually started having suicidal thoughts and barely could provide myself with food from day to day. Through the internet I found out I had depression so I thought that I would be able to get treated and everything would go back to normal. Normal to me was not feeling anything by the way.

So I got into stationary therapy for two months and they diagnosed me with avpd in the end. I don‘t know how to tell how severe my condition is, but my favorite thing to do is sleeping and I can‘t get up in the morning because I just hate being awake. I just want to escape reality at all times. When I was hanging out with my object of limerance a lot, it was the first time in years in which I felt as if I was a real human being. I could comfortably talk with people without caring what they think about me, because at the end of the day she would still be there for me. I was able to feel a lot and even had something like a gut feeling on which I could base decisions on. I didn‘t understand how that worked for other people before. Now I feel like I am just dead inside.

I started seeing a therapist earlier this year, but I don‘t know how to feel about it. I don‘t see her often and all she does is prescribe antidepressants which make me feel depressed instead of not feeling anything. I don‘t know which one I like better.

I think I am a pretty intense example of someone with avpd but I can‘t tell because I don‘t know anyone else with it and even if I would know someone I wouldn‘t be able to read their minds. For me it‘s just the fact that I can’t relate to anyone around me combined with the 20 steps of anxiety that keeps me intensely lonely and depressed.
Depressivity, Anhedonia, Emotional lability, Separation insecurity, Intimacy avoidance, Withdrawal
No problem I just want to get this crap out somewhere. I have been more outgoing too, but I am very dependent on other people and eventually I get left behind.
Separation insecurity

I don’t eat a lot when I’m depressed, but I don‘t have problems with my weight at all. I can eat as much as I want and still don‘t gain weight. It‘s more of the opposite, because I am constantly bordering on being underweight. I usually have to force myself to eat at all times, but I started taking an ssri antidepressant and it helps me with my appetite.
Anhedonia, Depressivity

Ok I can‘t relate to that, I would love to gain weight, but I can‘t do it by just eating a lot and I am too lazy to do sports. But I guess that‘s because I am male. My guess would be that you are female, because I know females get obsessed with their weight. I used to smoke multiple times a week too. But I have concentration issues and daydream a lot so ssris are better for me I guess. But I am doubting it every day because weed would actually get rid of depression for me. Everything the ssri does is just make me feel sad and depressed instead of feeling dead inside. And I can‘t even tell if it‘s the ssri or if I am better at being concious about my feelings.

I guess that‘s easy to say but you shouldn‘t be afraid of gaining weight if you are underweight. Gaining weight definitely isn‘t a valid argument against ssris for you. I am actually not really a fan of taking antidepressants, but it’s just something I need to try to see if it does anything for me. I just lost all hope and don‘t even care about any values I believe in I just want this shit to stop. And it doesn‘t. At the moment I think I will probably go back to smoking weed in a few months, because that’s at least something I can do with other people and it works better for my depression. But I want to give my psychologist with her antidepressants a fair chance.
Anhedonia, Depressivity, Low invulnerability, Boredom proneness, Blame externalization

I was exactly the same. I always thought that at some point in the future everything would change. But I didn‘t know that I was the problem, I thought it was everyone else.

If you don’t do anything for it your hope is not reasonable. You have to try to learn to socialize better and I know it’s scary and hard but you have to work for your better future I guess. I got a bit better that way, but still a long way ahead.
Blame externalization, Low empathy

I would say, if you are really serious about it and don‘t mind her shortcomings due to the avpd, you need patience. I have been diagnosed and I would describe avpd like this: When you meet someone new you have to “break the ice“ to be more comfortable. The thing with avpd is that you have multiple ice layers. And there are lots of them and it‘s really difficult and scary to break some of them which haven’t been broken for the entire life. I think it is possible to break all the layers but not likely. Another factor is that the broken layers close up again if you don’t keep working on it. 

I guess you should take this comment with a grain of salt, because I am talking about my personal experiences and avpd is just a generalization to treat these people. But it works differently for every individual. You might still understand this order better now just don‘t be 100% sure that everything I said applies to her.
Withdrawal, Intimacy avoidance

I would say it‘s the latter. I always think they see me as a creep somehow and I actually believe that‘s what they think. I often make other presumptions which I know are likely wrong, but this one gets me.
Separation insecurity, Negative relationships, Suspiciousness

I know what you are talking about. I have kind of trained myself to look them straight in the face for a few seconds, even if they are looking back, and then look at something else. It feels the least awkward to me. But when I am depressed I can‘t do it and just don‘t even care.
Withdrawal, Depressivity, Intimacy avoidance

I definitely have a lot of repressed rage. Sometimes I think I can relate to serial killers, because I have so much hate inside of me. But I don’t think anyone deserves to be hated so I keep it all bottled up inside.
Hostility, Emotional lability, Negative relationships, Low empathy
I always try to force trust somehow. I know it’s an issue so I try to compensate it.
Separation insecurity

I‘m just trying to adapt, while not losing my identity. I am basically always looking for a way to get out of my comfort zone. I hate being alive, but it’s partially my fault, so I might as well be able to change it with a lot of work, time and patience.
Identity problems, Depressivity

I don’t think it went too bad for my standards and yes I was awkward, but still able to hold conversations. It even got pretty personal at points. But I just want to do something exciting today and just have no idea what to do. I don‘t even care a lot about if she just wants to be friends tbh I‘m greatful for anything.

I just want to use this opportunity to face my fears. I appreciate your well meant advice against it, but I‘m gonna do it.
Excitement seeking, Low timorousness
thx this was basically the crap I was too dumb to understand. I already see the responses about self deprecation. You don‘t have to tell me
Ineptitude
I do love my self. Or at least I like myself. But that doesn’t mean I believe other people are able to.
Low empathy

I‘ve been there and I am still working on getting better, but you just have to get some activities going which aren’t inanimate sensations. I have been making music and I love video games so I bought a gameboy and started making music with it. I also got back into bmxing. It helps with getting a sense of identity.
Identity problems, Anhedonia

I think for me it’s being a virgin, even though I‘m only 21. The thing is I don’t want to answer why I‘m still a virgin to almost anyone. I just feel like I am missing out on something I shouldn’t be missing out on.

But I am not interested in fucking a prostitute, because I want to trust someone on that level. I think that could be very therapeutic. This comment turned out longer than I imagined 😅
Separation insecurity, Intimacy avoidance, Negative relationships
Just googled it and I definitely have some weird outbursts of anger at times. But I never do it when it would be too weird. I can hold it back very well.
Hostility, Low timorousness
My argument would be that i have been like that before i even had much access to screens but I dont know. I guess this is just me trying to tell someone my disorder is real.
Identity problems

Thanks a lot for the reply. I‘m not giving up that easily, but I at least needed random strangers on the internet to know. I know my thoughts are turning against me and that’s what I am afraid of. I am aware of a lot of garbage that my avpd tries to tell me, but I am scared of the things I overlook.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability, Withdrawal

Thanks a lot for the long response, I really apreciate it. I called her 3 times today after thinking about it all day for the past couple days. First and last time she didn‘t respond and the second time someone picked up (or the phone did by itself?) and I just heard people talking in the distance.

I am trying but I feel like I‘m just a joke to everyone. I fight all of my fears and trauma and try so hard and I barely ever get anything in return. I have tried to be more open about stuff but it got to the point of oversharing and I think it just pushed her away.

The difficult part is that she is scared too so I can’t really tell if she’s mad at me, scared, or just plainly uninterested. She probably also thinks I just want to have sex even though I‘m so scared she would have to rape me to have sex with me. I just want to know what to do to see her again at least once, but I know no one can.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability, Separation insecurity, Negative relationships, Fragility

I know honesty should be worth a lot, but if you have as much pain inside as I do it just pushes everyone away so it’s not really helping at all. Honesty just makes people think I‘m desperate, insane, weak, a serial killer and the list goes on.
Fragility

It‘s impossible for me to tell, but maybe she actually wants to see you and thinks she screwed up. I would tell her you aren‘t mad at her for bailing and maybe ask her for a phone call or something like that first if she starts texting back. You have to convince her she did nothing wrong somehow even though one might argue she did.

I made plans with someone for tomorrow and I‘m really scared to call or text her right now so I think I can relate to her somehow, I guess.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability, Separation insecurity

I only use weed. But it has a useful effect to me. When I‘m overthinking and freaking out weed makes me care less and I can overthink without all of the paranoia. At times it‘s still bad even when I‘m high, but there is no cure I guess. I know overthinking isn’t really the best thing to do, but I can’t help it and I think I have learned a lot through it already even if it’s exhausting at times. I would be interested to hear about experiences with psychedelics too.
Anxiousness, Perseveration

I relate to this a lot. I have been supressing all of my emotions from 15 to 19 years old and at 19 when I couldn‘t stop crying out of nowhere, I thought something was wrong and I basically went into stationary therapy to get rid of my feelings again. It took a while, but I changed my mind completely. Nowadays I think emotions are basically everything that makes my life worth living. Even pain and sadness.

My father definitely never wants to see me angry or annoyed by anthing. When I‘m depressed he says I shouldn‘t let my emotions out on everyone around myself, even though he is the one who screams at everyone when he‘s angry, but he thinks he‘s the boss so he‘s allowed to and no one else is. I really hate him most of the time. I don‘t even want to hate him, but that‘s just my natural reaction to his behaviours.

I have been showing more and more of my anger in front of my father recently, because there is no way for me to pretend any longer. If I would I would just explode one day. The fucked up part is that in the past the issue didn‘t exist, because I didn‘t feel anything and he thinks I can just go back to being like that. But my narc dad is not gonna keep me from having feelings.

I know it really sucks. You should plan to move out from home as soon as possible. I always have to think about my parents when changing something in my behavior or when certain feelings show up. You should be able to feel whatever you feel like and express that without being judged. My only way to be able to show my feelings in front of my family is just to not give a shit about what anybody thinks, which I know isn‘t a typical AVPD thing. But I think we should try to act a bit more careless and “savage“ to compensate the inhibitions.
Emotional lability, Negative relationships, Hostility

I make music too and i relate to not being able to create. But I think you just have to express your feeling of being unmotivated in music. Create the music you would want to hear right now. I have made a couple of songs with really sad piano chords and the drums are slow and kinda off and it just perfectly expresses the grief and hopelessness i was feeling. I don’t think you have to release anything just create some low effort shit for yourself. 

In music I just do what I feel like doing I don’t do it for anyone to like it but myself. It is really empowering and I wish I could apply that mindset to more parts of my life and that’s what I am working on.
Anhedonia, Depressivity

It could always be worse, you could try to make friends with the quiet woman. The worst thing that could happen is you losing a min wage job you hate. I know the panic can‘t just be rationalized away, but maybe thinking about it like that makes it better.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability

AvPD is just a label. I used to be like you, I couldn‘t tell you how I was feeling. I was diagnosed with autism when I was younger, but I don’t believe that diagnosis. When I was in therapy I got diagnosed with AvPD and I would say I had some schizoid traits and still do. 

It doesn’t really matter if the therapist says you have it or not in my opinion. You should get more in touch with your feelings before you can really tell if you have AvPD.
Identity problems, Intimacy avoidance, Withdrawal, Withdrawal

That‘s a really good question and it‘s hard to answer. Meditation can help. I would just close my eyes, breathe in and out slowly and pay attention to how every part of my body feels. Does my back hurt? Are my shoulders stiff? and so on. The first step is just focusing on your body. Focusing on the present not the past or the future or any daydreams.

Sports or just going for a walk could help too. Just going for a walk and paying attention to how your legs feel while doing it, maybe you feel cold. Just focus on all the sensations in your body and trying to stay in the present. Maybe you feel anxious when you’re going outside you shouldn’t ignore that either. That‘s a feeling. It’s unpleasant, but it can‘t kill you.

I don’t know if this is helpful to you at all, but just know that I am still struggling with this stuff so you really need to be patient. My ability to feel didn’t come back overnight and I still lose it every now and then.

I hope this helps and you can get in touch with your feelings, because I think feelings are a very valuable thing. I prefer being lonely and miserable over not feeling anything.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability, Low restricted affectivity, Anhedonia
I feel exactly the same. I would love to get used to physical touch, but I can‘t do that by myself and it’s difficult to find someone.
Intimacy avoidance, Withdrawal

I don’t believe there is a point or a reason for any of this. It‘s just our parents being unable to give us what we need, because their parents didn‘t. No one gets punished it’s just bad luck. None of this means anything. I‘m just looking for another girl to obsess over until she tells me she just wants to be friends, because that’s the only way to make me feel better for a limited time.
Anhedonia, Depressivity, Negative relationships, Identity problems

Waiting definitely doesn’t do the trick for me. I have to go for it very actively to get any kind of relationship with anyone going. What I meant in this post is that in my case AVPD is all about being scared of meaningful relationships and you can‘t overcome this fear without trying to have that with someone.
Intimacy avoidance

I know I have to put in work and I do. The problem is that I can‘t really do anything by myself at home. There always needs to be someone who I am interacting with. The problem is just, that I overreact about stupid shit and get back into isolation. The worst part is my self awareness about how stupid this is, but I don’t have the power to do anything but watch myself do it.
Emotional lability, Withdrawal

I don‘t disagree with you at all. The problem is that my mindset prevents me from having positive experiences with others. Also I never had a SO. I meant that I can‘t convince myself of being worthy by myself. I can‘t become more confident by myself. My confidence is highly dependent on how others treat me. I get to the point where social interaction is just too much. I can do it, but I can’t come across as confident or even take part in a conversation. I can’t even think straight.

So I think I would need someone who doesn’t mind, when I am in that headspace. The problem is I can’t even explain myself when I am in that situation.
Separation insecurity, Low invulnerability
I do feel the same, but I don’t mind having suicidal thoughts in a store. I wear a very flat unsociable mask. The problem is that I only take it off when I‘m by myself.
Anhedonia, Withdrawal

I‘m 21. This year I started riding BMX again (I used to do it in my teens) and I know it makes me feel better. The problem is the weather, because I have already been sick a couple of days ago and it’s freezing cold outside. I know I am going to have to find a way to get through the winter, but I don’t know what to do yet, because I hate going to fitness studios and definitely don’t want to pay to hate going there. It would be okay if it was just strangers, but I hate seeing people I know  and I live in a small town so that’s very common. I feel so stupid writing this down, like I’m just making up excuses, but I know if I ignore these things I will overestimate myself and be disappointed and even more depressed than before.

But thanks a lot for the reply.
Anxiousness, Depressivity, Withdrawal

I feel like this is what I should be doing right now, but I’m completely letting go and just staying at home, sleeping too much, smoking weed, playing video games. I think the main reason for this is that I got rejected and I feel worthless. There is no reason for me to get up in the morning so I don’t. I don’t want to do anything and I don’t.
Anhedonia, Depressivity, Withdrawal

I can relate to this a lot. Just now I received a text and I am already imagining how the conversation would go, if I answered right now. But when there’s no one around I think of how to talk to someone, because I want to and then I just lose track of reality and talk about my deepest feelings in my head. This is not in the dsm so it doesn’t really matter if you have this or not to get an avpd diagnosis, but I was diagnosed and I know what you are talking about.
Cognitive/perceptual dysregulation, Fantasy proneness

I relate to what you‘re saying a lot. I always feel like the black sheep. I think it’s because I convinced myself for years, that I am not like anyone else. People told me I changed and I always disagreed when they said so. Even if I was actually doing better. I knew I would go back at some point.

I understand what you mean by everything feeling fake. I am always too honest. I don’t say things with the intention to make someone like me. I feel like most people do it instinctively without thinking about it. I just talk about what I am thinking about.

I don’t like most peoples games so I don’t play along.
Identity problems, Withdrawal

I did twice. The first time I was kind of manic and just called her and told her I loved her like an insane person. Second time I was too slow I guess. She liked me for a while and changed her mind after she got to know me better. I even wanted to be friends afterwards but that didn‘t work out either, because she told me it’s a good thing I‘m isolating myself so no one gets to know my shitty personality. 

I don’t mean to be discouraging and I hope someone else can tell you about their positive experiences, but I can’t. I was trying to grow and prove to myself that people aren’t as scary as I think, but that kind of backfired, I guess. Maybe just be wary, if he seems like the judgemental type.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability,  Withdrawal,Negative relationships, Fragility

I relate very well to what you are saying. I feel like my soul gave up on living half a year ago, but my body and mind don‘t agree. I haven’t met anyone in real life who understands yet. Maybe there is nothing to understand. I also don‘t know how to be honest with people without pushing them away, because I genuinely stopped caring about everything and everyone. Maybe it‘s me being overly sensitive to people treating me like garbage. Maybe it’s the weed. Maybe both.
Depressivity, Withdrawal

I think the problem is just that the advice you are talking about is meant for people without avpd. My opinion is that you should be very upfront about your issues just maybe don’t let them think you are crazy. Also I think rushing things isn’t a good thing for us.

My tinder bio says shy and awkward and I’m a guy so that’s probably not the best option for getting as many matches as possible. But the ones that do match will have a grasp on what I‘m like. I am not interested in impressing someone with my fake confidence to get them into bed. I‘d rather have a friend who likes me for who I am.
Separation insecurity, Intimacy avoidance,  Low attention seeking, Withdrawal

Yes, but it’s not just with strangers. I even avoid my family members from time to time. I can’t be honest with anyone anyways, because I waste most of my time on youtube videos and video games. I wish I could trust someone, but I can’t take the risk at the moment because I think I can only take so much perceived criticism at a time.

The word perceived is important. Many avoidants including me are very sensitive and constantly looking for a negative reaction from others. I know about that and still can’t help it. Everyone who is remotely nice either doesn’t know me yet or is using me. I don’t want to be around people. Sometimes I think meeting friends would make me less lonely, but most of the time I feel worse afterwards, because of all the things I am ashamed about.

avpd is not just social anxiety. You’re not anxious, you’re terrified.
Intimacy avoidance, Withdrawal, Negative relationships, Separation insecurity

It can get better and it can get worse there is no answer. For me it is always an inner conflict of not wanting to be alone, but at the same time not feeling safe around people. I don‘t even blame them It‘s probably my fault for always dissappearing for days and being too scared to care about anyone. I think it is going to be hard and you have to decide for yourself if it’s worth it.
Separation insecurity, Intimacy avoidance

I relate a lot to what you wrote. I had friends every now and then, but I‘m just really bad at maintaining any kind of relationship.

I cried a lot as a child, but learned to keep my emotions to myself, because my entire family made fun of me saying I cry like a little girl. Years later my father asked me if I had emotions at all. To this day I am having trouble showing any emotions and if I do it doesn’t really help. I trust no one and don’t even bother anymore to be honest. 

Opening up to people just ended up traumatizing me even more, because I don’t know who to trust and I am overly sensitive to criticism. People don’t understand how scary it is for people with avpd to even try to be friends with someone. And I‘m sick of trying.

I hope you don’t end up like this, because nobody deserves to, no matter what your messed up brain tells you.
Separation insecurity, Low restricted affectivity, Intimacy avoidance,  Withdrawal

How would you even do that? No matter how hard I tried to see everything in a positive light and being grateful for the smallest things even these things turned out to not be real in the end. I know all of the distortions in my head, yet I don’t have any idea how I could just “have a positive experience“. I just don’t.
Depressivity, Fragility, Anhedonia
I was diagnosed and found this subreddit afterwards. You should try to get into therapy somehow, if you can relate to this subreddit. If you are too scared to try you might have avpd.

I (22M) am in the same boat basically. I don‘t even care if it’s dating, being friends or anything. I just want to have an engaging conversation with anyone, yet I can’t even bring myself to care about almost everything.
Anhedonia, Withdrawal

No. I hate it 24 hours a day every day. I can’t express myself properly about anything, fear is always holding me back. I hate myself, because I don‘t do anything against the avoidance, but I wouldn’t know what to do without traumatising myself again. And at the same time I don’t want to kill myself, because it would hurt my family. I wish I was actually cold as a brick, so I could at least end this garbage.

I stopped smoking weed yesterday, so that might be part of why this comment is so negative.
Anxiousness, Low restricted affectivity, Separation insecurity, Fragility, Low invulnerability, Anhedonia, Depressivity

Avoidants are overly sensitive, so the walls serve a very useful purpose. Just smashing them would be like throwing someone, who can’t swim, into the sea. I have learned the hard way. I thought facing my fears would help me defeating them, but it ended up reinforcing them and my “walls“ are stronger than ever before.
Separation insecurity, Withdrawal, Fragility

That’s easy to say. Opening up to people just made me feel worse. Just imagine being told you should isolate yourself more, because you are a shitty person. By the person you tried to open up to and trusted the most. I have been talking to her for months and even told her about things, that happened in my childhood nobody else ever knew about. You can’t even imagine how open I was. I was more open than the average non avpd guy. And I can’t even begin to explain how much I regret that. I wouldn’t be able to tell you about a single person that was good for me.
Separation insecurity, Negative relationships

I relate to basically everything you said, except maybe job related stuff, bc I am still in college.

I live in a small town too, and I think you could get to know people online somehow. Tinder doesn’t necessarily require you to show your face, but people could just assume you’re ugly, I guess. But I wouldn’t recommend tinder anyways, unless you set your expectations low and just laugh at all of the stereotypes on there. Taking that stuff too seriously can be really depressing.

i personally wouldn’t want kids, because seeing them grow up to be like me would be one of the worst things i could imagine. i saw my parents fuck up first hand and i would want to be sure to be at least a decent parent. i can’t talk for your so, but i wouldn’t want to live with having raised someone who wishes he/she wasn’t born.
Fragility, Negative relationships

It’s really hard and scary, but accusing me of being a pedophile was crossing a line. Now I see that he will never change and never even try. I‘m just scared of becoming like him when he’s around me too much so I had to make a decision for once. He is the reason I am always trying to be compassionate and that’s not even a good thing per se.
Anxiousness, Emotional lability, Negative relationships, Fragility

I wouldn’t be able to tell if it’s just avpd, but I have a very similar outlook on humanity. I also pace around and daydream a lot and I bet there must be tons of other eerie similarities.

I hate most people, because I have dissected social interactions from a emotionally detached place for years now. But if I talk to someone who genuinely cares about how I feel and respects me, in spite of me being the worst hermit of them all, it makes me forget about society and how it works, because it doesn’t matter. I know I am really lucky to have people like that in my life.

I think most people see avoidants and think we’re just shy, lazy, awkward and maybe even psychotic. No one is concerned about what this situation looks like through our eyes. But that’s not true. Some people do and if I was you I would keep looking somehow and talk to a lot of shitty people to get to the nice ones eventually.

You are not crazy. This society barely ever rewards compassion, but it does reward being a sociopath more than anything. Just know that other people can see it too and think it’s wrong too, you‘re just going to have to find people, who can think for themselves.
Emotional lability, Intimacy avoidance, Withdrawal, Anhedonia, Negative relationships, Disaffiliativeness

I feel you. But I started using that "flaw" by making dreamy music. Just losing myself inside of ableton (music making software). It’s  something I can listen to in 10 years and tell myself I didn’t just rot away in my room. At least I worked on something that will last forever. You don’t have to do anything I or society tells you to do. If music is not your thing you can make shitty drawings all day or write cringy fanfictions it doesn’t matter. I can’t even describe how rewarding it is to get better at expressing yourself through any form of art. You could write stories you don’t even show to anyone that take place in your dreamworld and you would have an advantage compared to someone who is always living in present. I know you would be ashamed of it and probably hate it most of the time and I don’t like my music all the time. I barely ever show it to people and I’m totally ok with that. But when I meet someone I like I can at least show them how passionate I am about music and that’s always seen as a very positive trait. All I am saying is keep on dreaming, but don’t keep your dreams in your head. You might find a way to let them escape into the real world and make it a better place for yourself.
Fantasy proneness, Anhedonia

I would say there are two things that always help me improve, but I‘m basically as miserable as you are most of the time. 

1.	You should try to find people who try to understand why you are the way you are. I know it sounds obvious, but think about people in your life and their opinions of you. The less they try to understand your position the lower it is in my observations. You need a person who doesn’t mind listening to you complaining about your hardships, because they know it’s not as simple as it seems. That’s a lot easier said than done and I only recently met a girl on tinder and consider myself super lucky. Most girls want to get laid or even worse just want a bunch of guys complimenting them on an app. I wouldn’t really recommend tinder to any guy with avpd, but I didn’t really give a shit before I met her and just treated it as entertainment like youtube or something.
2.	This one is a lot more practical. You should find things you can do by yourself that statisfy you. I personally am a huge music nerd and make music myself. In my opinion you should aspire to be the greatest nerd and care way too much about whatever you’re passionate about. I make music when I’m really depressed even though I don’t even want to and you hear that in the disturbing results, but at least I gained some experience for when I am able to be passionate again.
Negative relationships, Anhedonia

its impossible to just ignore mean things so you should definitely look for a way to get some distance between you and your parents. the easy route would be acting cold towards them and not letting them get to you, but thats only healthy in doses so you cant just do that forever. you should look into living somewhere else no matter how.
Withdrawal, Intimacy avoidance

I‘ve been in a similar situation multiple times and I know how you feel. You should start doing the smallest things to improve your day to day life and know that you’re trying your best. It’s not your fault and it’s ok to feel like there is no point in trying. But not trying will always make less sense to me personally so i tell myself i have to at least try something.

Just take a shower, brush your teeth, cook your favorite food or something you have never tried before. even if you hated every second of it afterwards, you should know that it can change at any given point and it will change at some point.

Doing things while being as depressed and lonely as you are is real tough, but that’s what you’re gonna end up being if you just push a tiny bit every day. real tough.
Depressivity, Anhedonia

I never really relied on alcohol. I do that with weed. I still find most of the things you said in this post very relatable. I think the people who are annoyed and stopped inviting you wouldn't find this post very relatable. And I don't think them stopping to invite you is necessarily a bad thing, because we are just not pleasant and not easy to deal with for many people. There are people who don't mind shy, awkward or even paranoid people, but they weren't the ones who stopped inviting you. They could also just think you don't like them you never know.

You should focus on people who clearly want to have you around, and on yourself of course. You don't have to be someone who loves drinking at parties, especially if you have AvPD.
Anxiousness, Intimacy avoidance, Withdrawal, Suspiciousness

I know it might blow your mind but you could just say "Sorry, I always get really nervous around new people." If she has got an issue with that she never liked you at all, because *you are nervous around new people*. If she doesn’t understand that, she is not even worth your time at all. In my humble opinion even 20 years of therapy probably won’t get you to be able to talk to a girl you like without being nervous. 20 years of dating girls certainly would help. 

I know it’s hell and I‘ve been where you’re at, but don’t think and just ask her out with a stupid message, bc in your head everything you do is stupid anyways so you can’t tell. There are girls out there who would certainly kill for a shy weirdo to ask them out. Not every girl wants a conventionally "attractive" guy, who is confident and whatnot.

If you ask me just hit her up. If you don’t know what to say, "hey, im sorry about being so awkward that time, im always nervous around new people. I think you’re really cute so we could go to *blank* on *date* at *time*, if you want to." could work wonders. Even better if you can come up with a geniune compliment about her other than just cute. You can even dm me if you want to I'd be glad to help and you can always complain to me if anything goes wrong.

I rejected a girl in school by mistake just by acting real nervous in front of people I didn’t even like while talking to her, bc I was insecure about what they would think about her. If I didn’t just start using tinder years later, I would probably still beat myself up over it. I know that feeling too well to just shut up about it now so I'm composing a fucking paragraph on reddit.

Also in your post you said you had to look that place up. You should tell her you don’t know the place and ask her to tell you about it in that situation. Everybody likes to be asked about something they like. I bet she would have loved to tell you everything about it.

All I'm trying to say is that you can be honest about not knowing things, never having been on a date, being stiff and robotic, being a huge nerd and spending too much time by yourself and still make a girl obsess over you. The fact that it’s difficult to get to know you can also work in your favour. If she already showed interest you are really fucking up by not doing anything imo.
Anxiousness, Fragility, Separation insecurity, Low invulnerability

I dont think she did that on purpose. I personally have come to understand that I‘m just too sensitive and just get hurt by people accidentally all the time. I dont think there are many people who would knowingly make the decision to hurt you. Many people are too concerned with themselves to even realize how the one person that doesn’t talk at all feels.

I think one of the core problems with avpd (for me at least), is that meeting people and making friends is a very casual thing for most people and we care way too much. There are girls who flirt with guys just for fun even though they’re not interested and that should tell you a lot about how other people work. Some people treat relationships like a game and there isn’t anything wrong with that necessarily, but it definitely doesn’t mesh well with avpd.

All I‘m trying to say is that you shouldn’t always listen to that voice in your head telling you that everyone hates you. But you definitely should be careful with who you are trying to open up to if you’re even able to do that. I have found I get along the best with more quiet and thoughtful people who actually listen and try to understand instead of just thinking you’re a loser.
Emotional lability, Separation insecurity, Intimacy avoidance, Negative relationships, Fragility, Withdrawal

"ill give you something to cry about" hit very close to home, I didn’t even remember it until now, but my father used to say that. I was being made fun of for crying by pretty much my entire family and they would talk and laugh about it months in advance. They kept telling me I was behaving like a little girl, so I became a soulless piece of garbage that "didn’t cry like a girl“. I only truly started understanding what real empathy means and how it feels like at 20 years old.
Emotional lability, Negative relationships, Low empathy

This could be written by me lol. I was thrown into very bad depression this year, bc i started trusting them somewhat. They started being fake nice to still secretly disrespect me and laugh at me. Just remember that they suck ass no matter if they try to be better. You don’t learn basic empathy after a certain age.
Depressivity, Negative relationships, Low empathy, Hostility, Blame externalization
no_evidence: This is definitely something I relate to. But I don‘t use tinder for the reasons you just named. Also I hate taking selfies so that basically makes tinder unusable for me.

I think they don‘t mean to hurt you. They are just not as sensitive as you are. I wouldn‘t take it that seriously and try to laugh about it too. I have friends who are like that and you just have to laugh about it or maybe make fun of them as well. It depends on what kind of a person you are or want to be I guess. I wouldn‘t take it that seriously. They are still hanging out with you so it can‘t be that bad.

Of course if you feel like following my advice is impossible you should probably try to find other friends.
yeah but still not really any ideas on what to do
I think you also have to be passionate about it. Music and art in general are some things I am very passionate about. If I show it to someone they see you as less of a emotionless person.

I use tinder every now and then out of boredom and i have been on dates with a girl once. It went kinda awful and I was really awkward, but she liked me for a while. Long story short: I fell in love with her, came across as needy, ended up in the friendzone. 

My advice, if you are looking for matches would be liking weirdos or people who come across as shy, because they hide their faces or something similar. But the most important thing and the hardest would be not to let it get to you. At the end of the day it’s just an app on your phone. Also guys just don’t get as many matches in general.

Also just liking everyone doesn‘t work, because you will start showing up less on others phones. There is a hidden system that rates how good of a user you are. So you should always like and dislike people to make your profile more likely to be liked.

I think tinder definitely isn’t made for overly sensitive people. On r/tinder they say there are 2 rules for success on tinder.
1) be attractive
2) don’t be unattractive

So just keep in mind that most people on tinder are surface level and don’t let it make you feel worthless.

I think nowadays it’s getting more and more common to put every opinion into a black or white box. Everyone has to be extremely positive about something or totally against it. I don’t understand it and I don’t have extreme opinions on everything. I think it’s the internet‘s fault in a way, because emotional, shocking, controversial and manipulative content will always get more likes, shares etc.
Yeah I get you and I knew, but I still want to make the best out of it you somehow. I‘ve been through it too.
